noun.description: More fully "†rouncival pease", "rouncival pea". A large variety of garden or field pea. Also (in plural): peas of this variety. Now chiefly historical.
A large, boisterous, or masculine woman. Compare rouncyrare after 17th cent.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in Thomas Tusser (c1524–1580), writer on agriculture and poet.
